originalTitle: Zimbabwe rejects 'lopsided' US health aid deal over data concerns
title: Zimbabwe rejects 'lopsided' US health aid deal over data concerns
content: Access to biological samples raised flags for Zimbabwe as the US did not want to share the benefits of its research.

originalTitle: Senegal PM proposes tougher anti-LGBT law, doubling prison terms
title: Senegal PM proposes tougher anti-LGBT law, doubling prison terms
content: The bill seeks prison terms of five to ten years for what it describes as "acts against nature".

title: Drones hammer Sudan's gold and oil zone - the pivotal new front line
content: Intensified attacks in the Kordofan region have led to mass casualties as peace remains elusive.

originalTitle: Why Indian PM Modi’s Israel visit matters for Pakistan’s security
title: Friends Far Away: India and Israel's Special Hello!
content:
Jambo from Africa!

Hello everyone! Your friend from Africa is here with some exciting news from far, far away! It's like a story about countries becoming good friends, just like you and your pals at school. Today, we're going to talk about India and Israel, and a special visit that happened.

Who is PM Modi?

First, let's meet a very important person. Have you ever heard of India? It's a very big country, super far from us, with lots of people and amazing food! The leader of India is a very kind man named Prime Minister Modi. You can call him PM Modi for short. He's like the head prefect of a very, very big school! PM Modi works hard to make India a happy and safe place for everyone. He travels to many countries to meet other leaders and make new friends for India. This helps India to learn new things and share its own cool ideas with the world.

Where is Israel?

Now, let's fly over to another country called Israel. It's also very far away, not as big as India, but full of interesting history and amazing places. Imagine a land with old stories and new technologies all in one place! The people of Israel are also working hard to build their country and make it strong. Did you know? Israel is known for making many new inventions, especially in farming! They have clever ways to grow food even where there isn't much water. Isn't that smart?

A Special Visit

Guess what? PM Modi from India went to visit Israel! He flew a long way to say hello to the leaders and people of Israel. When leaders visit other countries, it's like two friends coming together to play and talk. They share ideas and make plans to help each other. This visit was very special because India and Israel want to be even better friends. They want to work together on many exciting things. It's like saying, "Hey, let's be best friends and build amazing sandcastles together!"

Friends Help Friends

When countries become good friends, they help each other in many ways. For example, India and Israel can help each other with farming, so everyone has enough yummy food to eat. They can also share ideas about how to keep their people safe, which we call 'security'. They can also talk about new computers and smart ways to use science. It's like sharing your best toys and helping your friend build the tallest block tower. When countries help each other, everyone gets stronger and happier. Did you know? India is the second-most populated country in the whole world! That means a lot, lot, LOT of people live there. And they have very colourful festivals and delicious food like curry!

What About Pakistan?

Now, let's talk about another country nearby. India has a neighbour country called Pakistan. They share a very long border, just like two houses next to each other. Sometimes, countries that are neighbours might have different ideas or opinions. When India and Israel become very close friends, some smart grown-ups, called 'analysts', think this might make Pakistan think a little more about its own friendships. It's like if you and your two friends are playing, and two of your friends become super best friends, the third friend might think, "Hmm, maybe I should also make more friends or talk to them more."

What is Diplomacy?

This idea of countries talking and making friends is called 'diplomacy'. Diplomacy is when countries talk to each other to solve problems, share ideas, and make peace. It's like when you talk to your friend nicely to share a toy, instead of arguing. Good diplomacy helps everyone to live safely and happily. When India and Israel are very good friends, it might make Pakistan think about its own diplomacy. Maybe Pakistan will also try to make new friends, or talk to India and Israel in new ways. It's all about countries finding the best way to live together peacefully. Did you know? Pakistan has very tall mountains, including K2, which is the second-highest mountain in the world! Imagine how high that is!

Keeping Everyone Safe (Security)

Another important word is 'security'. Security means keeping everyone safe from harm. Every country wants its people to be safe at home, at school, and everywhere. Countries work together to share ideas on how to keep their people and their borders safe. When India and Israel are strong friends, they can share even more ideas about security. This might make other countries, like Pakistan, think about how they keep their people safe too. It's all part of making the world a safer place for all children and grown-ups.

The Big Picture: Friendship and Peace

So, PM Modi's visit to Israel is a story about friendship. It shows that countries, even if they are far apart, can become good friends and help each other. When countries are friends, they can share wonderful things, make new inventions, and work together for a better world. This friendship might make other countries think about their own friends and how they talk to everyone. It's like a big puzzle where everyone is trying to fit together nicely. Our hope is always for friendship, peace, and safety for all children and families around the world. It's a big, beautiful world out there, and learning about how countries become friends is super important! Until next time, stay curious and keep shining!
summary: India's leader, PM Modi, visited Israel to become better friends, which might make their neighbor Pakistan think differently about its own country friendships and how it talks to others.
whyMatters: This is important because when countries like India and Israel become very close friends and help each other, it can change how other countries, like Pakistan, think about keeping their people safe and how they talk to everyone else to make peace. It's like seeing your friends make new friends, and it makes you think about your own friendships too.

title: England to host Ukraine at Everton's Hill Dickinson
content: The Lionesses will host Ukraine in their Women's World Cup qualifier at the Hill Dickinson Stadium in June.

title: Terry 'frustrated' over Chelsea caretaker choice
content: Former Chelsea captain John Terry says he is "frustrated" at being overlooked for a caretaker role following Enzo Maresca's departure as head coach in January.
